dimension_options.label: Political
dimension_options.description: Factors related to government policies, regulations, and political stability.

dimension_options.label: Economic
dimension_options.description: Factors affecting the economy, such as inflation, unemployment, and economic growth.

dimension_options.label: Social
dimension_options.description: Societal and cultural aspects, including demographics, lifestyle changes, and social trends.

dimension_options.label: Legal
dimension_options.description: Legal considerations, including laws, regulations, and legal systems impacting the business.

dimension_options.label: Technological
dimension_options.description: Technological advancements and innovations that may affect operations and market dynamics.

dimension_options.label: Environment
dimension_options.description: Environmental factors, including ecological and environmental regulations, and sustainability issues.

dimension_options.label: Context Uncertainty
dimension_options.description: Factors related to industry flux, competitive pressure, and identifying new growth opportunities.

dimension_options.label: Strategic Awareness
dimension_options.description: Understanding of company strategy and execution according to objectives.

dimension_options.label: Cross-Departmental Collaboration
dimension_options.description: Collaboration across departments, cultures and regions to maximize business opportunities.

dimension_options.label: Change Management
dimension_options.description: Leadership capability in guiding organizations through change and transformation processes.

dimension_options.label: Customer Centricity
dimension_options.description: Focus on customer needs and customer-centric approaches.

dimension_options.label: Digital Transformation
dimension_options.description: Leadership clarity in digital value creation.

dialogues.description: Addressing periods of extreme flux and competitive pressure in the industry.
Evaluating organizational understanding of company strategy and execution.
Examining execution capability for successful strategy implementation.
Addressing collaboration across departments, cultures and regions.
Evaluating leaders' capabilities in guiding transformation processes.
Addressing customer-centricity and understanding of client needs
Addressing leadership clarity in digital value creation.

questions.question: In our industry, we face a period of extreme flux and great competitive pressure in which we need to
questions.description: In our industry, we face a period of extreme flux and great competitive pressure in which we need to identify new ways of doing it (existing business) and new sources of growth outside our traditional activities.

questions.question: Today, the entire organization has fully understood what the companyâs strategy is about and has sta
questions.description: Today, the entire organization has fully understood what the companyâs strategy is about and has started to execute according to its objectives.

questions.question: At our company, we are missing a strong execution focus to successfully implement our strategies.
questions.description: At our company, we are missing a strong execution focus to successfully implement our strategies.

questions.question: At our company, we miss out on business opportunities because collaboration across departments, cult
questions.description: At our company, we miss out on business opportunities because collaboration across departments, cultures and regions does not work smoothly.

questions.question: At our company, leaders are strong in guiding and leading the organization through change and transf
questions.description: At our company, leaders are strong in guiding and leading the organization through change and transformation processes knowing how to engage our companyâs workforce and building the required strategic capabilities.

questions.question: At our company, we are customer-centric towards our clients and we precisely know the needs of them.
questions.description: At our company, we are customer-centric towards our clients and we precisely know the needs of them.

questions.question: At our company, innovation is not seen as a responsibility of everyone.
questions.description: At our company, innovation is not seen as a responsibility of everyone.

questions.description: At our company, our leaders are not clear how to successfully lead digital value creation.

justification.justification: "Great competitive pressure" is true for most applications, however, there are a few, where we have significantly lower pressure, than in others. "new sources of growth outside our traditional activities" definetly true. However, the traditional business has to fund the new businesses and has to be kept in focus accordingly.

Collaboration and communication across departments and regions is enhanced significantly in the last years. We promote collaboration by promoting job rotations and diversity. Also a good example of enhancing communication and collaboration is applying the CRM tool which gives insights to all about market and projects and keep everyone up to date.
By far not clear to everybody. question of most employees is, what the plan is with "their" products, which has not been answered yet in depth
I believe leadership is highly committed. I also believe that in many cases the balance between short term results and long term sustainability must be found.

We are very product-driven meaning our customer approach is centered around the question which products we want to sell him. A really customer-centric approach would be first to listen to the customer and find out his problems and then thinking about our products afterwards

I see the teams in my department is working extremely hard to find new ways of doing things. This informs future strategy, investment and execution decisions. I do not believe this is the case collectively unfortunately as there appears to be resistance to change and continuous improvement in some areas.
There are good examples, but there is room for improvement. New business models needs to be clear and understood to ensure appropriate technical solutions.
Our business is fast in changes, so we need the flexibility to react on these changes on the market. To focus on execution is right for sure, but not if "strong" means "unflexible".

publish_framework.title: Leadership Themes Assessment
publish_framework.description:
This short real-time Delphi study serves as part of our joint preparation for your HSG-ES Business Mastery program at the University of St.Gallen starting in 2025. The idea is to collect your opinions about how your company X deals with the topics we want to explore during the entire program. 

Don't worry, we DO NOT conduct a classic survey but simply list 8 (partially controversial) statements (it's on purpose). For each statement we want your level of agreement (0 - 100) as well as a short explanation why you agree or disagree with the respective statement.
In return, you will be able to see after each statement how your opinion stands compared to your peers that have also participated and what kind of arguments they have provided for a high or low assessment. 
All your inputs will be treated completely confidential & anonymous and will be analyzed as a group result. Nobody at MAN-ES will know who has rated each statement how and why.

We estimate that this Delphi study will not require more than 15 minutes of your time.

Please answer this study LATEST until end of 2025! 

Thank you for your participation!

Kind regards, 

RM
publish_framework.introduction:
Delphi Study - TUTORIAL

Dear Participant,


After submitting your input for one of the eight statements, please click on the NEXT button. This will enable you to view the assessments of other participants, along with their reasons for a high or low assessment. Your assessment will be indicated by an RED DOT within the box plot overiew.

  • You will also see the quartile values represented in the box plot and can check the specific comments made by your peers per quartile.
  • At the top left corner, you can access all comments per statement directly and filter them according to your needs.
  • You then have the opportunity to revise your assessment if the explanations provided by your peers have changed your opinion. You can do this by clicking on the BACK button before proceeding to the next projection.

If you don't want to make any adaptations to your assessment or arguments, simply press the NEXT button again.  You may pause the study at any time by closing your browser window. You can resume where you left off by using the study link provided or login to your new residency account.

Let's begin!

value.justification: I completely agree with this.

"Great competitive pressure" is true for most applications, however, there are a few, where we have significantly lower pressure, than in others. "new sources of growth outside our traditional activities" definetly true. However, the traditional business has to fund the new businesses and has to be kept in focus accordingly.
"Identify new ways of doing it (existing business)" is not the only way. It's also augmentation and expansion.
value.justificationMd: "Identify new ways of doing it (existing business)" is not the only way. It's also augmentation and expansion.

value.justification: Test
This is justified because I have made good experiences....

I believe much still needs to be done to saturate the organisation with the business strategy. In many cases individuals on the coal face are still predominantly engaging in activities related to the "old business" and do not experience the new direction in every day life.

In the last 3 years a lot of good activities to communicate our strategy have taken place. However, as our organization is slow to accept changes, it might take some time until everyone has adopted the new strategy
I agree

The new organisation in the Front End with splitted powers between Regions and Segments needed some time to become effective which lead to several missed opportunities and efforts in vain. However I see improvements ongoing.

My perseption is that after many years of having several organisational silos e.g. PrimeServ and New Sales, all drilled to only seek for their own best, we have made a great way forward already in terms of collaboration and reaching goals together. Certainly the new oranisation with the "regional front end" being much more in the focus brings challanges however with role models on regional and segment side accepting the change and creating success will change the organisation as well.
value.justificationMd:
- My perseption is that after many years of having several organisational silos e.g. DIMEServing and New Sales, all drilled to only seek for their own best, we have made a great way forward already in terms of collaboration and reaching goals together.
- Certainly the new oranisation with the "regional front end" being much more in the focus brings challanges however with role models on regional and segment side accepting the change and creating success will change the organisation as well.

value.justification: Disagree

Top management and board have made good job in communicating the startegy and the necessary steps of the transformation. However, it is a challenge to really anchor the new way in each and every employee and process

For the majority of our leaders that is correct, not for everyone. Some leaders needs more bravery to push the transformation.
We have a strong leadership with very good connect across functions and levels.
most of the leader prefer to do it old way
value.justificationMd:
- For the majority of our leaders that is correct, not for everyone. Some leaders needs more bravery to push the transformation.
- We have a strong leadership with very good connect across functions and levels.
- Most of the leader prefer to do it old way

value.justification: Agree

We are very product-driven meaning our customer approach is centered around the question which products we want to sell him. A really customer-centric approach would be first to listen to the customer and find out his problems and then thinking about our products afterwards

We have a lot to offer, but there still is room for improvment, especially when it comes to solutions.
We can improve to develop products which are demaned as well as sustainable due to financial targets. Sales and Execution can reinforce relationship tocustomers.
value.justificationMd:
- We have a lot to offer, but there still is room for improvement, especially when it comes to solutions.
- We can improve to develop products which are demanded as well as sustainable due to financial targets. Sales and Execution can reinforce relationship to customers.

value.justification: Confused

I see the teams in my department is working extremely hard to find new ways of doing things. This informs future strategy, investment and execution decisions. I do not believe this is the case collectively unfortunately as there appears to be resistance to change and continuous improvement in some areas.
I do not agree because we have many innovative employees.
Agree

We need to make good investment for developing products suiting various kind of customer requirement as customers are extremely conservative/cautious to allow connecting their high value assets and their performance data to a wide open access network irrespective of securitization measures. We need a good speed in this area as many customer systems already implemented in their plants are highly advanced in this regard.

To develop a really attractive value proposition for our digital products is challenging. The way ahead is reasonably clear, however implementation to arrive at actual products for which the customer is actually willing to pay is very hard work
I think there are very good ideas. But often it is not easy to implement it in such a big company.
I'm kind of in the middle on this one

I experience a strong focus for execution within the Management to drive the change in our portfolio. However, we still have several major development programs in their finalization phase that need to be finished before full focus on strategy implementation is possible.

The cooperation between locations and countries could be improved to better know other initiatives and focus on implementing them togehter.
To overcome the structural obstacles as mentioned before
Not all decision making processes in the company are synchronized with the corporate strategy. Product Strategy is better integrated than Decision making for CAPEX or adaption of IT projects/ressources.
